clinical_study.brief_title: Post-Operative Pain Scores and Analgesic Requirements After Elective Inguinal Herniorrhaphy
clinical_study.official_title: An Investigation of Post-Operative Pain Scores and Analgesic Requirements After Ambulatory Inguinal Herniorrhaphy With Pre-Operative Gabapentin Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The study will investigate the effects of single dose pre-operative oral dose of gabapentin (1200) on post -operative pain scores and oral analgesic requirements.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will benefit patients in reducing post-operative pain scores as well as reduction in oral analgesic consumption. Gabapentin has been shown to reduce post operative pain pain scores in breast surgery, hysterectomy , spinal surgery, orthopedic and thyroid surgery

clinical_study.why_stopped: Changes to surgical practices led to the loss of eligible patients for this study.

study_design_info.masking: Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor

primary_outcome.measure: Post operative pain is reduced when single pre-operative oral dose of Gabapentine is given to the patient before the Inguinal Herniorrhaphy

secondary_outcome.measure: The post operative analgesia requirement is also reduced

arm_group.description: Active treatment with the study drug
Placebo arm for blinding the medication

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects having elective surgery with open unilateral Inguinal herniorraphy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non elective surgery
- Patients currently on gabapentin therapy
- Patient hypersensitive to gabapentin surgery
- History of alcohol or drug abuse
- Patients who are pregnant or who are nursing
